comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3420) (MYAIR-3835)
# 1. When the patient goes to the coaching section for the first time on a given phone then Monte Carlo shall ask the patient for permission to enable push notifications
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. ( https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

# Note 3: When testing manually, after the test steps, sign into the support website from Note 1, and check that the push token is there if the scenario has enabled push notifications. If the scenario has not enabled push notifications, the push token should not be there.
# Note 4: If the patient chooses to enable push notifications then both Coaching and Cleaning Reminder push notifications are to be enabled.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: After installing the app, go to the "Coaching" screen, disable push notifications and verify the dialog is dismissed and system dialog does not display

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Later" button
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I navigate to the "Coaching" screen
I should not see the "Push notifications permission" dialog

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the badge icon appears over the coaching tab following a "Sleep Library" push notification when on the Settings, and removed when navigating to the "Coaching" screen

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile" screen
a "SleepLibrary" push notification is received
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab
I tap the "Coaching" tab
I should be on the "Coaching" screen
I should not see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3435) (MYAIR-3848)
#1.  Given the user is signed-in, the App shall allow the user to change their password.
#2.  The App shall require the following before notifying server of the change password request:
#a) current password
#b) new password
#Note 1: See MYAIR-3846 for account password requirements
#Note 2: User must login after password is reset
#Note 3: If TouchID/FaceID is enabled then it is disabled until user enters account credentials
# Note: For Android it is called as "Fingerprint Authentication" whereas for iOS is called as "Touch ID"

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I have a device registered with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to see the Password screen so they can change their password

steps.name: I open the app on the "About me" screen
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Change password" button
I should be on the "Change password" screen

I tap the "New Password" field

I tap "Save" button

I press "Back"
I should be on the "Profile" screen
I press "Sign out icon" button
I press "Sign out" button confirmation

I press the "Sign in" button
I see the text "Email or password is invalid"
I enter "newPassword" into the "Password" field
I press the "Sign in" button
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen

I'm able to dismiss the "Server Error" dialog

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-694) (MCA-2048)
# 1. Each sleep score shall be accompanied with a message according to the following rules:
# | requirement id | Condition                               | Text                                                                      | Notes                                                     |
# | 1a             | Usage is greater than 7 hours           | Excellent results, name! As you start to see the benefits in your life,   | name is replaced with the user's first name               |
# |                |                                         | you’ll never look back.                                                   |                                                           |
# | 1b             | Usage is less than or equal to 7 hours  | That's a great score! You're well on your way to improving your health.   |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 4 hours                |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1c             | Usage is less than or equal to 4 hours  | Good start! Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy will    |                                                           |
# |                | and greater than 2 hours                | get easier the more you practice.                                         |                                                           |
# | 1d             | Usage is less than or equal to 2 hours  | Keep going name! If you're finding it difficult to get started, seek out  | name is replaced with the users first name                |
# |                | and greater than 0 minutes              | support. Try the myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                 |                                                           |
# | 1e             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used last night! Do you need more support? Try the    |                                                           |
# |                | for the latest sleep record             | myAir Library or talk to your clinician.                                  |                                                           |
# | 1f             | Usage is zero minutes and the score is  | Your machine wasn't used this night.                                      |                                                           |
# |                | not for the latest sleep record         |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1g             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | Last night's data isn't available yet.                                    |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there is data for the       |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | previous sleep record, or this is the   |                                                                           |                                                           |
# |                | only sleep record available             |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1h             | No data, score is for the latest sleep  | myAir hasn't received data from your machine for some time. To ensure     |                                                           |
# |                | record, and there has been no data for  | that your machine can send data, review the tips on the Missing Data page.|                                                           |
# |                | the most recent 2 or more sleep records |                                                                           |                                                           |
# | 1i             | No data, score is not for the latest    | myAir didn't receive data from your machine for this night.               |                                                           |
# |                | sleep record                            |                                                                           |                                                           |
# Note: Monte Carlo only receives the number of therapy sessions per sleep record and does not know when each therapy session starts and ends.
# Note: Monte Carlo has the timestamps when therapy starts and stops

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when running 6 hours of therapy when crossing noon-to-noon boundary, applicable message appears

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "That's a great score!" in the "Score Message" label
I should see the value "You're well on your way to improving your health." in the "Score Explanation" label

arguments.val: You're well on your way to improving your health.

elements.name: Verify when running 3 hours 59 minutes of therapy, applicable message appears

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I should see the value "Good start!" in the "Score Message" label

arguments.val: Keep going. Like learning anything new, using therapy gets easier the more you practice.

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives a HTTP 601 response from Patient Portal on About me screen, the user shall be instructed to update their app

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "601"
I navigate to the "About me" screen
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I should see the "instructions to update the app" item
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I close the app
I open the app
I should be on the "App Deprecation" screen
I cannot go back from the "App Deprecation" screen

elements.name: Verify when Monte Carlo receives 503 server error on the "My notifications" screen, MC will notify the user that the myAir server is under maintenance and return the user to the "My notifications" screen.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Profile" screen
I wait for data sync
Patient Portal will send an HTTP "503"
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I should be on the "Total Outage" screen
I tap the "Close Total Outage" icon
I should be on the "My notifications" screen

name: App Deprecation and Server Error from Patient Portal

elements.name: The user does not have an internet connection and tries to send contact support request

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "myAir Support" screen
I tap the "contact myAir support" item
I input valid information in all "Contact support" fields
I enable airplane mode
I tap the "Submit" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog

comments.value: # "Save" button in Android is considered the same as "Update" button in iOS for "Update mask" screen

elements.name: The user does not have an internet connection and tries to update mask info in "Update mask" screen

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
I open the app on the "Update mask" screen
I select "Nasal" for Mask Type
I select "ResMed" for Mask Brand
I select "Swift FX Nano" for Mask Model
I enable airplane mode
I tap the "Save" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog

elements.name: The user does not have an internet connection and tries to sync the dashboard

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I enable airplane mode
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I tap the "Dashboard" button
I should see the "Connection error" dialog

elements.name: Patient Portal Server does not respond when user tries to sync the dashboard

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-502) (MYAIR-1060)
# 1. If the user is logged in, actioning a notification will open Monte Carlo to the appropriate screen
# 2. If the user is not logged in, they shall be moved to the login screen (note: default login action after logging in)
# 3. If the user actions a Coaching Push notification, the coaching section shall be updated
# Note 1: See https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/Push%2C+Coaching+Tips+and+Library for details
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user
# IMPORTANT: need a clean install of the App

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings

elements.name: When user is logged in, opening notification will open appropriate type screen

I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
Push notifications are enabled
the app is in the background
a "ScoreTip" push notification is received with body "Remember to keep your device powered for at least 1 hour after use, so myAir can give you your sleep score!"

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-187)
# Note 1: This card deals with the general use case scenario. Activation errors and retries will be handled in another card.
# Note 2: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# Note 3: This card requires that an api call is made to login service
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2309) (MYAIR-3226)
# 1. After the first successful login of a user, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. date and time that the app was first used
# 1b. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-131)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-347)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-219)
# Note 1: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated and the account is active, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-747)
# 1. On every login, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. push token (if user is logged in and push is enabled)
# 1b. platform (i.e. iOS)
# 1c. date and time that the app was first used
# 1d. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-147) (MYAIR-355)
# Note 1: This card deals with the scenario when the user has entered incorrect login details multiple times.
# 1. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be told to wait and try again
# 2. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to enter log in credentials
# 3. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to start the reset password workflow
# Note: Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

steps.name: I install the app for the first time
I open the app on the "Signin" screen

elements.name: When user enters a valid and activated email and password on the signin screen, Dashboard screen is displayed

steps.name: I enter "test.user1640@gmail.com" into the "Email" field
I enter "Password1" into the "Password" field
I press the "Sign In" button
I should be on the "Home" screen

name: log in, sending data to Patient Portal during login, and forgot password

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-453) (MCA-2442)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3050) (MCA-2495)
# 1. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the usage in hours and minutes, rounded down to the nearest minute
# 2. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Good" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is less than 24 L/min
# 3. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display "Adjust" if the 95th percentile of the mask leak is equal to or greater than 24 L/min

# 4. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the events per hour as an index of the total number of Apnea, Central Apnea and Obstructive Apnea and Hypopnea events, per hour of usage, with a tolerance of +/-0.1
# 5. For each sleep record, Monte Carlo shall display the number of mask pairs
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-1142) (MCA-2494)
# 1. If the usage for a Sleep record is zero minutes, the score shall be zero
# 2. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *raw data values* shall be shown as a dash
# 3. If the usage for a sleep record is zero minutes, the *score breakdown values* shall be zero
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-1633) (MYAIR-2262)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall show the Sleep Score received from Patient Portal
# 2. The Sleep Score shall be displayed with the start date for the beginning of the sleep record
# 3. If new Sleep Score data is received for an existing sleep record, the most recently received Sleep Score shall be shown

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

comments.value: # Note: Duration table cell is in minutes

elements.name: Monte Carlo displays items on the Dashboard correctly when it receives a no usage sleep record from Patient Portal.

I see these scores
